question.title: how to read these specific line in java

node.contents: i have a csv file like this:

astNode.text: i have a csv file like this:

node.contents:
how do i read these line to 4 different array/arraylist in java?
the output i want is something like this:

astNode.text:
how do i read these line to 4 different array/arraylist in java?
the output i want is something like this:

node.contents:
• 1st line: 0 [1st array]
  • 2nd line: 1 2 3 [2nd array] --> just 1 line but the length of the token is unknown
  • 3rd line: 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 [3rd array] --> just 1 line but the length of the token is unknown
  • rest of the line: --> fixed 3 token, but the number of the row is unknown
    0 1 A
    0 5 B
    1 1 A
    1 3 B
    2 6 A
    2 4 B
    3 6 A
    3 4 B
    4 6 A
    4 4 B
    5 1 A
    5 5 B
    6 6 A
    6 2 B

  • rest of the line: --> fixed 3 token, but the number of the row is unknown

node.contents: can't get it right with the combination of scanner and switch-case condition..

astNode.text: can't get it right with the combination of scanner and switch-case condition..

node.contents: You can use Scanner's nextLine to read the lines. Since you specifically want the 1st, 2nd and 3rd line to belong to the 1st, 2nd and 3rd arrays respectively, you can call read 3 times and then use String's split method to populate the array. Once you are done, you can create a loop and populate the arraylist in which way you want.

astNode.text: You can use Scanner's nextLine to read the lines. Since you specifically want the 1st, 2nd and 3rd line to belong to the 1st, 2nd and 3rd arrays respectively, you can call read 3 times and then use String's split method to populate the array. Once you are done, you can create a loop and populate the arraylist in which way you want.

node.contents: So basically: Read and Split (for each of the first 3 lines) and then read and populate in a loop for the rest of the file.

astNode.text: So basically: Read and Split (for each of the first 3 lines) and then read and populate in a loop for the rest of the file.

node.contents: how to implement every read method to handle one line format?

astNode.text: how to implement every read method to handle one line format?

node.contents: I would not use switch. Just read the file line by line. If the file is generated (or you are otherwise sure that it is correct) than you could read it like

astNode.text: I would not use switch. Just read the file line by line. If the file is generated (or you are otherwise sure that it is correct) than you could read it like

elements.contents: reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(...)); array1 = readFirstLine(reader); array2 = readSecondLine(reader); array3 = readThirdLine(reader); // and so on

units.rawText: reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(...)); array1 = readFirstLine(reader); array2 = readSecondLine(reader); array3 = readThirdLine(reader); // and so on

node.contents: and implement every read... method to handle one line format.

astNode.text: and implement every read... method to handle one line format.

node.contents: Update: The read methods could look something like

astNode.text: Update: The read methods could look something like

elements.contents: private String[] readFirstLine(BufferedReader reader) { String line = reader.readLine(); String[] fields = line.split(","); return fields; }

units.rawText: private String[] readFirstLine(BufferedReader reader) { String line = reader.readLine(); String[] fields = line.split(","); return fields; }
